description.original_author: University of Oldenburg, Cluster of Excellence Hearing4all
description.other_contributors: Mareike Buhl, Birger Kollmeier, Antje Wulff
description.other_details: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.

Brand, T., & Hohmann, V. (2002). An adaptive procedure for categorical loudness scaling. The Journal of the Acoustical Society of America, 112(4), 1597-1604.
Hellbrück, J., & Moser, L. M. (1986). Psychophysical measurements of inner ear processes with category scaling of loudness. ORL, 48(2), 135-136.

details.purpose: To record responses to loudness scaling tests and calculate respective individual loudness growth functions.
details.use: Use to record responses to loudness scaling tests and calculate respective individual loudness growth functions with or without using hearing aids.
details.misuse: Not to be used to record any other auditory assessment than categorical loudness scaling. Use the specific archetypes for these purposes.

items.items: Psychophysical measurement describing suprathreshold loudness perception.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Identification of the ear(s) to which the test stimulus is being presented.
The test stimuli were presented to the right ear only.
The test stimuli were presented to the left ear only.
The test stimuli were presented to both ears simultaneously in a soundfield.
The reported loudness category for a given stimulus level.
Frequency of stimulus tested if applicable.
Needs to correspond to 'Type of test stimulus', for example frequency for pure tones or as a center frequency for narrowband noises.
Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms.
For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR.
The environment in which the audiometric test is administered.
This data element is commonly used in industry hearing programs.
Test environment that has been treated acoustically.
Test environment that has not been treated acoustically.
Identification of the stimulus used in the categorical loudness scaling procedure.

If the type of stimulus is broadband, use 'Name of test stimulus' for further specification. If the type of noise is a tone or a narrowband noise, use 'Frequency of test stimulus' for further specification.
The test stimulus is a tone burst.
The test stimulus is a click.
The test stimulus is a frequency modulated tone.
The test stimulus is a pure tone.
The test stimulus is a narrow band noise centred on the specified frequency.
The test stimulus is a pulsed pure tone.
Details of device used to present test stimulus as specified in 'Presentation method'.
For example type of headphone or speaker.
Details of the hearing device used.
For example: hearing aid or cochlea implant as type of device.
The reported loudness category for a given stimulus level.
Slope values for lower and upper section of fitted loudness growth function.
The reported loudness category for a given stimulus level.
The test stimulus is a broad band noise.
The method used to present the test stimulus.
The stimulus is presented via a loudspeaker located at least one metre away from the subject.
The stimulus is presented via insert earphones.
The stimulus is presented via external headphones - either circumaural or supraaural.
Additional narrative about the measurement of categorical loudness scaling not captured in other fields.
Further specification of test stimulus if applicable.
Needs to correspond to 'Type of test stimulus'. For example free text description or specific name like IFNoise or Icra1.
The test stimulus is a natural/recorded sound.
Combination of level and category of fitted loudness growth function, e.g. levels for 2.5, 25 and 50 CU.
Number of points should allow to reproduce the fitted loudness growth function.
The level of the stimulus for the corresponding CU value of fitted loudness growth function.
The loudness category for a given stimulus level of the fitted loudness growth function.
Name of the applied procedure to fit the loudness function to the data. Include a literature reference if applicable.
Add any additional information to describe the fit, e.g. the equation of the function with fitted parameters.
Identification of the side where the hearing device is worn during the test.
Additional information about the hearing device that is not captured in "Hearing device" or "Side of hearing device".
For example information about hearing aid settings.
The hearing device is worn at the left side.
The hearing device is worn at the right side.
For example specific audiometric booth or a free text description treatment.
